page.title: 13Blithfield Church
page.content: Blithfield Church as mentioned in the Doomesday Book 1086 where it was recorded as Blidevelt. A village of lithfield is said to have existed near the church held by Roger de Lacy . Members of the Blithfield family worshipped and were buried in the church until the Bagos took over the hall in 1360. The Georgian rectory was burnt down in 1962. The church stands in an isolated position behind the Hall and is approached from the north side by a long single track road between fields. It is kept in good repair although some fine 13th centuary stained glass field. The east window was erected in the 1960s to the memory of the 6th Baron Bagot. The parishoners care for the graceyard which is still used. The church is now kept locked because of the fear of theft.
